remarks.para: The class provides implementations of common elements for the and controls.
The following properties are of primary concern to users of a data-bound or : , , , and properties.

summary.para: Provides a common implementation of members for the and classes.
Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets a value indicating whether the list enables selection of list items.

remarks.para: The property is valid if the property is set. If this is not a data-bound control, the default is null.

summary.para: Gets the associated with this control.

remarks.para: There are two ways to fill the and controls.
For example, you can add objects to the by using the method. You can also add objects to a by using the , , and properties to fill the .
When the property is set, a user cannot modify the items collection.
If setting the property causes the data source to change, the event is raised. If setting this property causes the data member to change, the event is raised.
When you set to null, is set to an empty string ("").

summary.para: Gets or sets the data source for this .

remarks.para: For more information about handling events, see Consuming Events.

summary.para: Occurs when the changes.

remarks.para: The controls that inherit from can display diverse types of objects. If the specified property does not exist on the object or the value of is an empty string (""), the results of the object's ToString method are displayed instead.
If the new display member cannot be set, the previous display member setting is maintained.

summary.para: Gets or sets the property to display for this .

remarks.para: For more information about handling events, see Consuming Events.

summary.para: Occurs when the property changes.
Retrieves the current value of the item, if it is a property of an object, given the item.

Docs.param: The object the item is bound to.

MemberSignature.Value: protected object FilterItemOnProperty (object item, string field);

summary.para: Returns the current value of the item, if it is a property of an object given the item and the property name.

Docs.param: The object the item is bound to.
The property name of the item the is bound to.

remarks.para: The event is raised before each visible item in the is formatted. Handling this event gives you access to the string to be displayed for this list item, through the property of the .
For more information about handling events, see Consuming Events.

summary.para: Occurs when the control is bound to a data value.

remarks.para: Setting the property will override the default formatting behavior, which uses the setting.

summary.para: Gets or sets the that provides custom formatting behavior.

remarks.para: For more information about handling events, see Consuming Events.

summary.para: Occurs when the value of the property changes.

remarks.para: The format string used must follow standard dnprdnshort format specifications. For more information, see Formatting Overview.

summary.para: Gets or sets the format-specifier characters that indicate how a value is to be displayed.

remarks.para: For more information about handling events, see Consuming Events.

summary.para: Occurs when value of the property changes

remarks.para: Setting the property to true causes the event to be raised for each visible member of the .
, , and are related as follows:

item.para: If is false, will not be set to -1 when is blank.
If is true, will be set to -1 when is blank.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether formatting is applied to the property of the .

remarks.para: For more information about handling events, see Consuming Events.

summary.para: Occurs when the value of the property changes.
Returns the text representation of the specified item.

returns.para: If the property is not specified, the value returned by is the value of the item's ToString method. Otherwise, the method returns the string value of the member specified in the property for the object specified in the parameter.

Docs.param: The object from which to get the contents to display.

summary.para: Handles special input keys, such as PAGE UP, PAGE DOWN, HOME, END, and so on.

returns.para: true if the parameter specifies the , , , or key; false if the parameter specifies .

remarks.para: Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Raising an Event.
The method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

summary.para: Raises the event.

Docs.param: An that contains the event data.

summary.para: When overridden in a derived class, resynchronizes the data of the object at the specified index with the contents of the data source.

Docs.param: The zero-based index of the item whose data to refresh.

summary.para: When overridden in a derived class, resynchronizes the item data with the contents of the data source.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract int SelectedIndex { set; get; }

summary.para: When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets the zero-based index of the currently selected item.

remarks.para: If a property is not specified in , returns the results of the ToString method of the object.
, , and are related as follows:

item.para: If is false, will not be set to -1 when is blank.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void SetItemCore (int index, object value);

summary.para: When overridden in a derived class, sets the object with the specified index in the derived class.

Docs.param: The array index of the object.

summary.para: When overridden in a derived class, sets the specified array of objects in a collection in the derived class.

remarks.para: Specify the contents of the property in cases where you bind data.
You can clear the property by setting the property to an empty string ("") or null.
Setting a new property raises the and events.

summary.para: Gets or sets the path of the property to use as the actual value for the items in the .
